events.title: ‚ÄúPrompt to Image‚Äù ‚Äì AI Creativity Competition
events.description:
## Introduction

Prompt Engineering has emerged as a critical skill in the modern AI-driven landscape. For engineers, keeping pace with this evolution is no longer optional but an industry-level expectation. Prompt Engineering focuses on the structured and creative formulation of inputs that guide AI systems to produce intended and meaningful outputs.

In this context, the **Computer Engineering Innovation and Tech Club (CITC)** proposes an AI-based creative competition titled **"Prompt to Image."** This event aims to provide students with a practical platform to explore prompt design, understand human‚ÄìAI interaction, and demonstrate creativity by transforming textual prompts into compelling visual outputs using AI tools.

## Objectives of the Event

The primary objectives of the Prompt to Image competition are:

- To encourage creative and innovative use of Artificial Intelligence
- To develop practical skills in prompt engineering
- To enable students to express ideas, emotions, and social issues through AI-generated visuals
- To enhance digital creativity, innovation, and technological awareness
- To promote intra-college participation and collaboration
- To promote ethical and responsible use of AI technologies

## Event Description and Execution Plan

The Prompt to Image competition is designed to evaluate participants' creativity, storytelling ability, and understanding of prompt engineering rather than dependence on advanced or premium AI tools.

To ensure fairness, originality, and consistency, participants will be provided with a structured paragraph-based prompt framework containing predefined blank spaces. This approach ensures equal creative opportunity for all participants while emphasizing logical thinking and narrative coherence.

### Prompt Framework Design

Each participant will receive one standardized paragraph template prepared by the organizing committee. The paragraph will contain multiple blank sections that participants must creatively complete.

**Sample Prompt Framework (Illustrative):**

> "In a future where ‚Ä¶ dominates society, a ‚Ä¶ stands in the middle of ‚Ä¶ The atmosphere feels ‚Ä¶, symbolizing ‚Ä¶ Soft ‚Ä¶ surrounds the scene, while ‚Ä¶ represents hope, conflict, or transformation. The visual style reflects ‚Ä¶ , capturing a message about ‚Ä¶"

Participants must fill in all blanks while maintaining:

- Logical flow
- Originality
- Creative storytelling
- Ethical sensitivity

The completed paragraph will serve as the final prompt used to generate the AI-based image.

## Evaluating Criteria

The final score will be calculated based on:

### 1. Judges' Evaluation (60%)

Submissions will be evaluated by multiple judges using a structured rubric to ensure fairness.

- **Creativity & Originality** (15%)
- **Prompt Quality & Human Intent** (15%)
- **Visual Appeal & Prompt‚ÄìImage Alignment** (15%)
- **Concept Explanation & Reasoning** (10%)
- **Ethical & Responsible AI Use** (5%)

### 2. Public / Social Engagement (40%)

Engagement will be measured from official competition posts shared through CITC-designated platforms.

- **Likes / Reactions** (15%)
- **Shares / Reposts** (15%)
- **Comments** (10%)

## Prize Structure

üèÜ **Winner:** NPR 3,000  
ü•à **First Runner-Up:** NPR 2,000  
ü•â **Second Runner-Up:** NPR 1,000

events.title: Kickstart Your Tech Journey: Explore ‚Ä¢ Learn ‚Ä¢ Build
events.description:
**Theme:** "Explore ‚Ä¢ Learn ‚Ä¢ Build ‚Äî Your Journey as a Computer Engineer"

## EVENT OBJECTIVES

- Introduce CITC ‚Äî purpose, vision, activities
- Familiarize students with major domains of Computer Engineering
- Give short & practical roadmaps for each domain
- Introduce essential tools, software, and platforms useful for daily CE life
- Show benefits & opportunities ‚Äî GitHub Student Pack, learning platforms, hackathons
- Build excitement, confidence, and curiosity among participants
- Recruit engaged members for future events

## STRUCTURE OF THE SESSION (1.5‚Äì2 hours)

### Starting-part

**1. Opening (5‚Äì7 mins)**

*Who speaks:* someone

Include:
- What is CITC?
- Why it was started?
- What problems it will solve for CE students?
- What activities/events to expect this semester?

**Introducing CITC Activities (2-3 mins)**

Explain what CITC will do:
- Workshops
- Project building groups
- Hackathons
- Weekly coding sessions
- Robotics arm project
- Web development bootcamp
- AI learning circles
- Open-source contributions
- Doubt-solving or peer mentorship

**2. Warm-up Interaction (3‚Äì5 mins)**

Quick questions about interests in AI, Web dev, Cybersecurity, etc.

### Major part

**3. The Core Part ‚Äî Major Domains in CE (25‚Äì30 mins)**

**A) SOFTWARE**
- Web Development (Frontend, Backend, MERN)
- AI / Machine Learning
- UI/UX
- Mobile App Development
- Cybersecurity
- DevOps & Cloud
- Data Science
- Game Development

**B) HARDWARE**
- AR/VR
- Embedded Systems / IoT
- Robotics

**5. Essential Tools & Software for CE Students (10‚Äì12 mins)**
- Daily tools: VS Code, Git & GitHub, Docker, Postman
- OS: Linux
- Productivity: Notion, Obsidian, Trello
- Design: Canva, Figma
- Cloud: GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel

**6. Opportunities & Perks for CE Students**
- GitHub Student Developer Pack
- Hackathons
- Internships
- Online certificates

### Demo/Entertainment Session

**7. Mini Demo Session (10 mins)**

### Closing part

**9. Q&A + Feedback (5‚Äì7 mins)**

**10. Closing (2‚Äì3 mins)**
